## Pull request overview This PR synchronizes the BNF grammar specification with the actual parser implementation and introduces the first automated test suite for the Sigil compiler. The changes align with issue #4, addressing mismatches between the documented grammar and parser behavior without introducing breaking changes to the language. **Changes:** - Restructured BNF to use direct recursion for expressions, eliminating unnecessary intermediate productions - Added support for string literals, decorators, and `.gesture` member access in BNF - Removed colon separator support for named call arguments (standardized on `=`) - Fixed broken STRING regex in lexer that incorrectly handled quote matching - Added proper exit codes (return 1) for parse and validation failures - Introduced bash test script with 8 test cases covering core parser features ### Reviewed changes Copilot reviewed 13 out of 13 changed files in this pull request and generated 3 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | grammar/sigil.bnf | Updated BNF to accurately reflect parser's recursive structure, added missing features (strings, decorators, dot-gesture), removed unused intermediate productions, standardized identifier tokens | | compiler/sigil.y | Added support for empty parameter lists `()`, removed colon separator for named arguments | | compiler/sigil.l | Corrected STRING token regex from broken pattern to proper alternation of single/double quoted strings | | compiler/compiler.c | Added non-zero exit codes for parse and semantic validation failures | | compiler/tests/test_parser.sh | New bash test runner with 8 test cases validating parser behavior for declarations, literals, decorators, named arguments, and expressions | | compiler/tests/fragments/*.sigil | Test fragment files generated by test script, covering basic functionality |
